items.title: Championship roundup: angry Lampard sparks confrontation as Coventry draw with Saints
items.summary: Championship leaders shrug off illness crisis Blackburn beat Millwall to ease relegation worries Coventry shrugged off an illness crisis and a half with 10 men as the Championship leaders secured a 1-1 draw at Southampton. Frank Lampard ‚Äì having been abused throughout the match by the home supporters ‚Äì gestured multiple times at the Saints fans after the match to spark a melee on the pitch. Tatsuhiro Sakamoto and the first-choice centre-backs, Bobby Thomas and Liam Kitching, all missed the game with a flu bug and Jay Dasilva was sent off 85 seconds into the second half. Ephron Mason-Clark had given the Sky Blues a first-half lead but they could not hold out as Nathan Wood levelled after the break. This story will be updated Continue reading...

items.title: Verrassing in Portugal: Farioli versterkt zich met Thiago Silva (41)
items.summary: FC Porto heeft zich verrassend versterkt met Thiago Silva. De 41-jarige Braziliaan tekent een contract tot het einde van het seizoen bij de club van Francesco Farioli, waar hij twintig jaar geleden ook al speelde.

items.title: Africa Cup of Nations springs surprise move to every four years
items.summary: Patrice Motsepe reveals change on eve of tournament Caf event held every two years since its inception in 1957 The Africa Cup of Nations will be held every four years instead of every two years from 2028, the Confederation of African Football (Caf) has announced. The tournament, which brings in an estimated 80% of CAF‚Äôs revenue, has been held every two years since its inception in 1957. Sunday marks the start of the 35th edition, hosted in Morocco with the home team taking on Comoros. The Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, said the next finals, scheduled for 2027 in Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda, will go ahead and another tournament would be held in 2028, but after that it will be hosted every four years. Continue reading...

items.title: Afcon to be held every four years from 2028
items.summary: In a huge change to the football calendar, the Africa Cup of Nations will be held every four years from 2028 - switching away from biennial finals.

items.title: Jo√£o Pedro rescues Chelsea draw as Newcastle squander two-goal lead
items.summary: Eddie Howe is synonymous with tidiness, efficiency and time management. Given that there is absolutely nothing slapdash, careless or wasteful about Newcastle‚Äôs manager his team‚Äôs increasing penchant for losing control is proving a puzzling paradoxes. Newcastle have developed a habit of throwing leads away this season and, 2-0 up thanks to a Nick Woltemade double, they were at it again here. Second-half goals from Reece James ‚Äì who was outstanding at both ends ‚Äì and Jo√£o Pedro ensured a much-improved Chelsea atoned for an abject first 45 minutes by departing with a point that could conceivably have been three. Newcastle have now dropped 13 points from winning positions this season. Continue reading...

items.title: Wanneer start de Afrika Cup en waar worden de duels uitgezonden?
items.summary: Aan het einde van 2025 gaat de Afrika Cup van start. Voor veel Europese clubs betekent dat dat zij spelers een tijdje kwijt zijn, maar voor Afrika is het vooral een groot voetbalfeest. Voetbal International praat je bij over het toernooi.

items.title: USMNT's Adams (torn MCL) out up to 3 months
items.summary: United States international Tyler Adams will be out for up to three months after tearing a medial collateral ligament, Bournemouth coach Andoni Iraola said Friday.

items.title: PSG GK fractured hand during shootout heroics
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup.
